metadata: (info { (description "O-Shogi was a game played in medieval Japan, recorded in the Futsu Shodo-Shu. It was an enlarged version of Shogi, with 29 different pieces.") (rules "15x15 board. 29 different pieces, 130 pieces in total.") (source "DLP evidence.") (id "1178") (version "1.3.14") (classification "board/war/replacement/checkmate/shogi/reconstruction/pending") (credit "Eric Piette") (origin "This game was played in Japan, from around 1297 to 1302.") } ) (graphics { (player Colour P1 (colour White)) (player Colour P2 (colour White)) (piece Families {"Defined" "Study"}) (board Style Shogi) (piece Rotate P2 degrees:180) }) (recon { (concept "NumStartComponents" 130) (concept "NumComponentsType" 29) })
